column4: hi... i'm troubled with monitor resolution setting... someone please help
i bought a monitor that demands 1440x900, and with the hints and instructions from the forums, i made the situation worse...
hi, the cube... i'm from Rio, Brazil
you try a sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg  ?
did it ask you for your resolution?
can you pastebin your xorg.conf file?  gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf  <--
did you try the advanced option in the reconfigure?

basically the command i typed above gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf will open your xorg file with a text editor then you can copy and paste this to the pastebin site:http://paste.ubuntu.com  and give us the url so we can view the file
make sure of the command. if you change the case X11 to x11 it wont open the right file
i might have to leave at any time so here is prob best.  can you pastebin also lspci -v > /home/$USER/file.txt   this will create a file.txt that you can open in an editor.
no problem nothing should happen. what that did was redirect the output of the lspci to a file so now do the command: gedit /home/$USER/file.txt  and pastebin that file
what resolution did you want again?
what does the command sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx   say?
do sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-96 then hit alt-ctrl-backspace  <-- note that this will reset X so youll lose any open apps
dont restart x if it says already installed only if it installs it
